        public QuestionWidget(android.content.Context context,
                      QuestionDetails questionDetails)

    • Method Detail

      • onCreateAnswerView

        protected android.view.View onCreateAnswerView(android.content.Context context,
                                               org.javarosa.form.api.FormEntryPrompt prompt,
                                               int answerFontSize)
        Returns the `View` object that represents the interface for answering the question. This will be rendered underneath the question's `label`, `hint` and `guidance_hint`. This method is passed the question itself (as a `FormEntryPrompt`) which will often be needed in rendering the widget. It is also passed the size to be used for question text.

      • setOnLongClickListener

        public abstract void setOnLongClickListener(android.view.View.OnLongClickListener l)
        Used to make sure clickable views in the widget work with the long click feature (shows the "Edit Prompt" menu). The passed listener should be set as the long click listener on clickable views in the widget.
        Overrides:
        setOnLongClickListener in class android.view.View

      • registerToClearAnswerOnLongPress

        protected void registerToClearAnswerOnLongPress(FormEntryActivity activity,
                                                android.view.ViewGroup viewGroup)
        Register this widget's child views to pop up a context menu to clear the widget when the user long presses on it. Widget subclasses may override this if some or all of their components need to intercept long presses.

      • cancelLongPress

        public void cancelLongPress()
        Every subclassed widget should override this, adding any views they may contain, and calling super.cancelLongPress()
        Overrides:
        cancelLongPress in class android.view.View

      • getInstanceFolder

        @Nullable
 @Deprecated
public final java.lang.String getInstanceFolder()
        Deprecated. widgets shouldn't need to know about the instance folder. They can use QuestionMediaManager to access media attached to the instance.
